bill.title: Relating to crime; prescribing an effective date.
bill.description: Provides that venue is proper in county in which victim resides for specified offenses, and in any county in which one offense was committed when defendant is charged with committing two or more property offenses against same victim within 180 days. Provides that venue is proper in county in which victim resides for specified offenses, and in any county in which one offense was committed when defendant is charged with committing two or more property offenses against same victim within 180 days. Authorizes reimbursement for cleaning expenses related to death of person as part of crime victims' compensation program. Expands crime of coercion to include using physical force to cause person to move, or prevent person from moving, from one place to another. Punishes by maximum of five years' imprisonment, $125,000 fine, or both. Takes effect on 91st day following adjournment sine die.

history.action: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
